post-trip-prompt.notification-title: How and why did you come here?
post-trip-prompt.platform-specific-message-ios: Swipe left or tap to add information about this trip.
post-trip-prompt.platform-specific-message-android: See options or tap to add information about this trip.
post-trip-prompt.platform-specific-message-other: Tap to add information about this trip.
post-trip-prompt.notifications-muted: Notifications for TRIP_END incident report muted
post-trip-prompt.notifications-reenabled: Can be re-enabled from the Profile -> Developer Zone screen. Select to re-enable now, clear to ignore

post-trip-map-display-tour-incident: Zoom in as much as possible to the location where the incident occurred and click on the blue line of the trip to mark a ‚òª or ‚òπ incident

trip-confirm.services-please-fill-in: Please fill in the {{text}} not listed.

general-settings.choose-dataset: Choose a dataset for carbon footprint calculations
general-settings.consent-not-found: Consent for data collection not found, consent now?
general-settings.no-consent-message: OK! Note that you won't get any personalized stats until you do!
general-settings.share-message:
Join me in making transportation greener and healthier 
Download the emission app:

diary.for-current-filter: for current filter. Show All to remove filters

new_label_tour.0: This is the new Label user interface. Label trips here instead of on the Diary page. Trips take longer to appear here, but when they do they will be more accurate and you will be able to use our new features to label them faster.
new_label_tour.1: This is the To Label tab. On this tab, only the trips you need to label will appear; when you label them, they will automatically disappear after a few seconds.
new_label_tour.2: Some of your trips do not appear in To Label because an algorithm labeled them for you. If you're  curious, you can see these in the other tabs, but you only need to label trips on the To Label tab.
new_label_tour.3: Trips now appear with the newest trip at the bottom.
new_label_tour.4: To load older trips, scroll up and press the load button.
new_label_tour.5: Labels are now red if we couldn't predict them, yellow if we could predict them, and green if you entered or confirmed them yourself.
new_label_tour.6: If you see yellow labels on the To Label tab, this means you need to confirm or correct them.
new_label_tour.7: If all of a trip's yellow labels are correct, you can click the checkmark button, which will turn them green (the checkmark button doesn't do anything to red or green labels.
new_label_tour.8: If certain yellow labels are incorrect, you can correct them just like you'd enter a label normally.
new_label_tour.9: When there are no more trips in To Label, you're done labeling for the day.
new_label_tour.10: The more you label your trips, the better the algorithm gets at predicting your trips for you, so keeping up-to-date with your labeling will save you work in the long run!
new_label_tour.11: Click the ‚Äò?‚Äô button whenever you'd like to view this tour again.

main-metrics.equals-cookies: Equals {cookies, plural, =0{0 homemade chocolate chip cookies} one {1 homemade chocolate chip cookie} other {# homemade chocolate chip cookies}}
main-metrics.equals-icecream: Equals {icecream, plural, =0{0 half cups vanilla ice cream} one {1 half cup vanilla ice cream} other {# half cups vanilla ice cream}}
main-metrics.equals-bananas: Equals {bananas, plural, =0{0 bananas} one {1 banana} other {# bananas}}

main-heatmap.title: Heatmap
main-heatmap.tour-datepicker: This heatmap shows the aggregate data for all E-mission users. Select the dates you want to see, and filter by hours of the day (24h format) and days of the week. For example, if you enter 16 and 19 in the last field, and select Monday and Friday, you'll see the Heatmap filtered to show the traffic on weekdays between 4pm and 7pm.
main-heatmap.tour-mode: Click here to filter your results by mode of transportation. The default is to show all modes.
main-heatmap.tour-get: Click here to generate the heatmap.

details.tour-detail-content: To report an incident, zoom in as much as possible to the location where the incident occurred and click on the trip to mark a ‚òª or ‚òπ incident
details.tour-sectionList-content: Trip sections, along with times and modes
details.tour-sectionPct-content: % of time spent in each mode for this trip

list-explainDraft-alert: This trip has not yet been analysed. If it stays in this state, please ask your sysadmin to check what is wrong.
list-tour-datepicker-button: Use this to select the day you want to see.
list-tour-diary-entry: Click on the map to see more details about each trip.
list-tour-map-fix-button: Use this to fix the map tiles if they have not loaded properly.

email-service.email-account-not-configured: Email account is not configured, cannot send email
email-service.email-account-mail-app: You must have the mail app on your phone configured with an email address. Otherwise, this won't work

email-log.body-please-fill-in-what-is-wrong: please fill in what is wrong

email-data.body-data-consists-of-list-of-entries:
Data consists of a list of entries.
Entry formats are at https://github.com/e-mission/e-mission-server/tree/master/emission/core/wrapper 
Data can be loaded locally using instructions at https://github.com/e-mission/e-mission-server#loading-test-data 
 and can be manipulated using the example at https://github.com/e-mission/e-mission-server/blob/master/Timeseries_Sample.ipynb

upload-service.please-fill-in-what-is-wrong: please fill in what is wrong

permissions.locationPermExplanation-android-lt-6: you accepted the permission during installation. You don't need to do anything now.
permissions.locationPermExplanation-android-gte-11: please select 'Allow all the time' for location permissions on the app page
permissions.locationPermExplanation-ios-lt-13: please select 'Always allow'. This allows us to understand your travel even when you are not actively using the app
permissions.locationPermExplanation-ios-gte-13: please select 'always' and 'precise' in the app settings page and return here to continue

updatecheck.download-new-ui: Download new UI-only update to build {{build}}?
